name: Compliance Export: Bot UserType identifies that the message is posted by a bot

customFields.Priority P1 to P4: P2 - Core Functions (Do core functions work?)

inline.description:
Identify that the message is posted by a bot
–––––––––––––––––––––––––
  1. Add a bot user
  2. Make that bot post a message
  3. Post a message as regular user
  4. Perform compliance export for CSV, Actiance and GlobalRelay
inline.testData:
Create bot user in Integrations, Postman:
curl -i -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"channel_id":"wktut4j8fjrm9jorug4zz67sfw", "message":"This is a message from a bot", "props":{"attachments": [{"pretext": "Look some text","text": "This is text"}]}}' -H 'Authorization: Bearer qxkbhqzemf8ptffpti7b88a1cy' https://rc.test.mattermost.com/api/v4/posts
inline.expectedResult: • Validate the field 'UserType' is present and is set to 'bot' or 'user' accordingly

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Story) Add an identifier for compliance exports when a message is posted by a bot account — MM-14721
customFields.Important notes about this step: For cloud testing, only able to verify compliance export for GlobalRelay. Don't have access to csv and actiance
